title: Taliban regime’s support for terrorists becomes a serious threat to regional peace
content:
ISLAMABAD, Nov 09 (APP): The Taliban regime’s continued support for terrorists and breach of commitments have become a serious threat to the entire region, as undeniable evidence of terrorism originating from Afghan soil has once again come to light.

Security sources said that second suicide bomber involved in the attack on Frontier Corps Headquarters (North), Quetta on September 30, has been identified as an Afghan terrorist. The Afghan suicide bomber affiliated with Fitna al-Khawarij has been identified as Muhammad Suhail alias Khabbab, they said.

Video Playerhttps://www.app.com.pk/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/WhatsApp-Video-2025-11-09-at-2.06.37-PM.mp400:0000:0000:00Use Up/Down Arrow keys to increase or decrease volume.

The sources said Muhammad Suhail alias Khabbab was a resident of Maidan Shahr district, Wardak province, Afghanistan.

Eight civilians embraced martyrdom while forty sustained injuries in the attack at FC Headquarters (North), Quetta.

The attack at FC Headquarters is the latest shameful example of Afghan terrorists belonging to Fitna al-Khwarij.
